{{also|东隅}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=东隅}}

===Etymology===
Literally: the eastern corner
: Used as a metaphor to describe the spot where the sun comes out; morning.
* ''c.'' '''398 - 445:''' Fan Ye ([[:zh:w:范晔|范瞱]]), ''[[w:Book of Later Han|Book of Later Han]], Scroll 17, The Biography of Feng Yi'' ([[:zh:source:後漢書|後漢書]]˙卷十七˙馮異傳)
*: [[可謂]][[失]][[之]]'''東隅'''，[[收]][[之]][[桑榆]]
*:: ''It may be said that if one loses it in the '''morning''', one gains it (back) at sunset.''

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=dōngyú
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# [[morning]]; [[daybreak]]
# eastern side (of a room)
